Men's lacrosse thrash Durham

The men's lacrosse firsts continued their sparkling form today, as they demolished a depleted Durham thirds side on the 3G Pitch

Below par basketball firsts suffer defeat

York's men's basketball team turned in a below par performance today as they fell to a fifteen point defeat to Newcastle's third team.

National futsal champions no match for table-topping York

York's futsal first team continued their impressive return to the BUCS Northern Premier League with an away victory over reigning national champions Teesside on Sunday (Thumbnail credit Action from Sunday's fixture on Teesside)

Alcuin comeback sinks Langwith

Alcuin forged a second-half comeback as they fell the right side of some contentious refereeing decisions on a sunny 22 Acres, despite Langwith leading at half time

Dominant James continue unbeaten run

James College rugby players continued their unbeaten run today as they eased past a depleted Goodricke-Langwith side to record a 34 - 0 victory

James and Vanbrugh share the spoils in close contest

Vanbrugh and an understrength James drew 1-1 on 22 Acres this morning, with goals from Phil Taylor and Josh Spurling

Four-goal Derwent end Wentworth's unbeaten run

Derwent leapfrogged Wentworth at the top of the college football table, winning 4-1 on the 3G pitch to inflict the postgrads' first defeat of the season

In-form Alcuin boss depleted Vanbrugh

Alcuin held off a competitive but understrength Vanbrugh side to record a deserved 39-12 victory in a scrappy yet entertaining college rugby fixture

Women's water polo take positives from defeat

The women's water polo side put in a performance to be proud of, but that couldn't prevent them from slipping to three narrow defeats at the York Sport Village this afternoon

Streetwise Northumbria too strong for men's volleyball firsts

Northumbria proved too good for the York volleyball men's team in an entertaining encounter, running out 3-1 winners

Women's rugby victorious on Merseyside

UYWRUFC turned around their difficult BUCS campaign yesterday with a closely contested win against Liverpool John Moores

Men's firsts thrash Hull in cup tie

An impressive first half by York was enough to give them the large goal deficit needed to advance to the next stage of the cup against a lacklustre Hull on the JLD

Netball firsts brave in face of cup defeat

York's netball team turned in sterling performance today at the hands of tough opposition Sheffield Hallam. Despite now being knocked out of the BUCS Cup, York can take heart from their brave effort against a side two leagues above them

UYRUFC hang on for Liverpool victory

The men's rugby firsts survived a late scare this afternoon, as they secured a nervy 31-27 win over Liverpool on 22 Acres

Winning start for York's high-flying futsal firsts

York futsal firsts kick-started their season back in the BUCS top flight with a determined 6-3 home victory over Sheffield firsts yesterday

Goals galore as futsal seconds edge Northumbria on penalties

A thrilling cup tie in the Tent saw the futsal seconds prevail on penalties, after a 7-7 draw with Northumbria

Wentworth put four past Alcuin to remain unbeaten

Disciplined defence and dangerous counter-attacks proved to be the difference as two each from Tim Martin and Dom Green led Wentworth to victory over Alcuin

Dodgeball delight for Derwent

Derwent emerged victorious over Vanbrugh from this afternoon's dodgeball contest, the first inter-college one day tournament of the year

James too strong for weakened Vanbrugh

James' rugby players proved too strong for a depleted Vanbrugh side today as they romped to a 56-10 victory

Points shared in eight-goal thriller

A half-strength Goodricke side pulled out all the stops against an in-form Derwent as the two sides battled it out in a fierce 4-4 draw

James prove their credentials in Langwith demolition

James' attacking quality proved the difference as they thrashed Langwith 7-2 on the 3G, including four from James Davies

Smart Halifax overcome spirited Goodricke-Langwith side

Halifax showed positive signs for the future as they completed an assured 27-17 victory over a representative Goodricke-Langwith side in Saturday's college rugby fixture

UYWRUFC made to suffer in Manchester

York's women's rugby side were on the end of a heavy defeat, as their difficult start to the season continued against Manchester University

Men's volleyball firsts fall short in Sheffield epic

York men's volleyball fell short of a memorable comeback, narrowly losing 3-2 in a five set epic to an experienced Sheffield side

Women's basketball sink Sunderland

York's women's basketball team sailed to an emphatic 27 point victory against a lacklustre Sunderland side

UYAFC earn win over Huddersfield

A goal in each half from James Davies and Dalton Harris respectively gave York a well-earned win over Huddersfield

Women's hockey thrash city rivals

The women's hockey firsts recorded a convincing 5-0 win over York St John on the JLD this afternoon to give them a first league victory of the season

Points shared in rugby thriller

Alcuin and Halifax rugby teams were forced to share the honours in their fiercely contested match on Sunday

An efficient first-half performance from Vanbrugh was enough to secure victory despite a late Goodricke comeback on Sunday
